error_details.explanation: Input misrepresentation. It seems the student calculated two-fifths of the basketball players (10), not of the total students (20), so the number of volleyball players should actually be 2/5*20=8 students.

context.question: N/A
context.flawed_solution:
#### 8
Half of the students are playing basketball, which means 20 / 2 = <<20/2=10>>10 students play basketball.
Two-fifths plays volleyball, which leaves us with 10 * 2/5 = <<10*2/5=4>>4 students.
One-tenth play both games, which means 20 * 1/10 = <<20*1/10=2>>2 students.
There are 10 + 4 = <<10+4=14>>14 students who play basketball or volleyball.
Among these 14 students, 2 of them are playing both games, so that means 14 - 2 = <<14-2=12>>12 students play only one of the two games.
So finally, 20 - 12 = <<20-12=8>>8 students do not play either game.
